## The Problem

### The Daily Holocaust

[150,000 people die daily](brain/book/problem/the-daily-massacre.qmd) from curable diseases - that's equal to [18,274 September 11 terrorist attacks](brain/book/problem/the-daily-massacre.qmd) per year.

<!-- {{< include brain/figures/disease-deaths-vs-historical-events-chart.qmd >}} -->

![Annual deaths from disease (54,750,000) versus deaths from 9/11 Terrorist Attacks (2,996)](assets/deaths-from-disease-vs-deaths-from-terrorism-chart.png)


Your body is quietly falling apart. Your cancer cells are multiplying RIGHT NOW. Your brain is deleting memories. Your joints are slowly turning into gravel. Your heart is getting tired of beating. Your telomeres are shortening. You are literally dissolving.

**You're a meat robot with worn-out parts. Every one of these failures is a solvable engineering problem.** 

You'd think we'd prioritize solving these problems. You'd be adorable for thinking that.

[We haven't cured a single disease](brain/book/problem/nih-spent-1-trillion-eradicating-0-diseases.qmd) in [50 years](./brain/book/references.qmd#smallpox-eradicated). But we have [13,000 nuclear warheads](brain/book/problem/cost-of-war.qmd), enough to end civilization 13 times, just in case the first apocalypse doesn't take.

### The Cost of War

We spend **[$2.72 trillion](./brain/book/references.qmd#sipri-2024-spending)** every year on stuff designed specifically to make humans stop being alive.

This shopping list includes:

- Nuclear bombs. 
- Bullets. 
- AI murder-bots. 
- Invisible jets that cost more than hospitals. 
- Satellites that can see your bald spot from space. 
- Probably some kind of earthquake machine.

Meanwhile, we spend [$68 billion on medical research](brain/book/reference/global-government-medical-research-spending.qmd). That's [**40 times less**](brain/book/problem/the-119-trillion-death-toilet.qmd) on curing all diseases combined than we spend on new ways to create corpses.

{{< include brain/figures/military-vs-medical-research-spending-bar-chart.qmd >}}

The Pentagon alone has [**lost** $2.5 trillion](brain/book/problem/cost-of-war.qmd). Not spent. Lost. Like change in a couch, except the couch is the size of Nebraska and the change could cure cancer hundreds of times over.

We have a Space Force but no Death Force. [Your chance of dying from terrorism: 1 in 30 million](brain/book/references.qmd#terrorism-vs-disease-risk). Your chance of dying from disease: 100%.

But wait. It gets dumber.


**[We spend 1,750 times more money](brain/book/problem/the-119-trillion-death-toilet.qmd) causing or mopping up death than preventing it.**
